1.1.3.24.TRANSFER: 1.3.3.12. the enzyme had been incorrectly classified as acting upon a ch-oh donor rather than a ch-ch donor .

1.3.99.3.TRANSFER: 1.3.8.7, medium-chain acyl-coa dehydrogenase, ec 1.3.8.8, long-chain acyl-coa dehydrogenase and ec 1.3.8.9, very-long-chain acyl-coa dehydrogenase

2.3.1.128.TRANSFER: 2.3.1.266, [ribosomal protein s18]-alanine n-acetyltransferase, and ec 2.3.1.267, [ribosomal protein s5]-alanine n-acetyltransferase.

2.4.2.23.TRANSFER: 2.4.2.2, ec 2.4.2.3, ec 2.4.2.4. this activity has been shown to be catalysed by ec 2.4.2.2, pyrimidine-nucleoside phosphorylase, ec 2.4.2.3, uridine phosphorylase, and ec 2.4.2.4, thymidine phosphorylase

3.1.2.24.TRANSFER: 3.13.1.3, the enzyme was incorrectly classified as a thiolester hydrolase when the bond broken is a c-s bond, which is not an ester.

4.2.99.19.TRANSFER: 4.4.1.23, 2-hydroxypropyl-com lyase. the enzyme was incorrectly classified as acting on a c-o bond rather than a c-s bond

5.4.2.1.TRANSFER: 5.4.2.11, ec 5.4.2.12. now recognized as two separate enzymes ec 5.4.2.11, phosphoglycerate mutase (2,3-diphosphoglycerate-dependent and ec 5.4.2.12, phosphoglycerate mutase (2,3-diphosphoglycerate-independent

6.3.1.16.TRANSFER: 6.3.3.6. the enzyme was discovered at the public-review stage to have been misclassified and so was withdrawn. see ec 6.3.3.6, carbapenam-3-carboxylate synthase

6.3.5.8.TRANSFER: 2.6.1.85. as atp is not hydrolysed during the reaction, the classification of the enzyme as a ligase was incorrect.
